problem: Find the greatest common divisor of $2863$ and $1344$.
solution:
We use the Euclidean algorithm.  \begin{align*}
\text{gcd}\,(2863,1344)&=\text{gcd}\,(2863-1344 \cdot 2 ,1344) \\
&=\text{gcd}\,(175,1344)\\
&=\text{gcd}\,(175,1344-175 \cdot 7)\\
&=\text{gcd}\,(175,119)\\
&=\text{gcd}\,(175-119,119)\\
&=\text{gcd}\,(56,119)\\
&=\text{gcd}\,(56,119-56 \cdot 2)\\
&=\text{gcd}\,(56,7).
\end{align*}Since $56$ is a multiple of $7$, the greatest common divisor is $\boxed{7}$.
model_solution:
## Step 1: Apply the Euclidean Algorithm
To find the greatest common divisor (GCD) of 2863 and 1344, we will use the Euclidean Algorithm. This algorithm involves repeatedly applying the division algorithm, swapping the remainder with the divisor, until the remainder is 0. The GCD will be the last non-zero remainder. We start by dividing the larger number by the smaller number to get a quotient and a remainder.

## Step 2: Perform the first division
2863 ÷ 1344 = 2 remainder 175


The final answer is: $\boxed{175}$
